item.title: Scripting Resources
item.description: In this page we report some useful examples and references to solve problems using bash scripts. Reduce number of concurrent Jobs Sometime you want to execute N concurrent bash scripts but you don’t want to overload the CPU. You prefere to control the execution such that anytime no more that K bash scripts are running together. In order to solve this problem you need to create a script like the following exec-async.

item.title: Freesurfer
item.description: Example on how to use FreeSurfer on Docker Assume you have a file anat.nii.gz and you want to perform recon-all on it: SUBJECT_ID=tizio INPUT_FILE=<the-path-of-anat-file>/anat.nii.gz Setup directory: mkdir -p $SUBJECT_ID/mri/orig cp $INPUT_FILE $SUBJECT_ID/mri/orig/ Creation of mgz docker run \ --rm \ -v $(pwd)/$SUBJECT_ID:/opt/freesurfer/subjects/$SUBJECT_ID \ -v /usr/local/freesurfer/.license:/opt/freesurfer/.license \ freesurfer/freesurfer:6.0 \ mri_convert \ /opt/freesurfer/subjects/$SUBJECT_ID/mri/orig/anat.nii.gz \ /opt/freesurfer/subjects/$SUBJECT_ID/mri/orig/001.mgz Recon all: docker run \ --rm \ -v $(pwd)/$SUBJECT_ID:/opt/freesurfer/subjects/$SUBJECT_ID \ -v /usr/local/freesurfer/.license:/opt/freesurfer/.license \ freesurfer/freesurfer:6.0 \ recon-all -s $SUBJECT_ID -all
